content: crocheted human ear by kitty-bob dk yarn 4 5mm hook using 2 strands of dk weight yarn and a 4 5mm hook gives a life sized ear if using one strand use a 3 5mm hook the following instructions make a right ear for a left ear reverse stitches british instructions ch5 loosely or ch6 if you crochet tight slip_stitch in first chain to join and form a ring ch3 5tr 5htr into ring - push the stitches so that they cover just over half the ring- work one half_double_crochet actually into the beginning chain to secure and prevent the other stitches from slipping turn ch2 fptr around including the ch3 at the beginning 11 do not turn 3dc slip_stitch in end space same place as last fptr turn ch1 decrease in front loops only of next 2 stitches double_crochet in front loops only of next 3 stitches double_crochet around do not turn 3htr 2dc in end space top of ch2 slip_stitch in the side to curl lobe around and fasten_off weave in ends using tail to close any gaps leaving the gap in the lobe if you want an ear piercing american instructions ch5 loosely or ch6 if you crochet tight slip_stitch in first chain to join and form a ring ch3 5dc 5hdc into ring - push the stitches so that they cover just over half the ring- work one half_double_crochet actually into the beginning chain to secure and prevent the other stitches from slipping turn ch2 fpdc around including the ch3 at the beginning 11 do not turn 3sc slip_stitch in end space same place as last fpdc turn ch1 decrease in front loops only of next 2 stitches single_crochet in front loops only of next 3 stitches single_crochet around do not turn 3hdc 2sc in end space top of ch2 slip_stitch in the side to curl lobe around and fasten_off weave in ends using tail to close any gaps leaving the gap in the lobe if you want an ear piercing if you want a backing for the ear hole then use a darker colour and ch4 double_crochet american single_crochet in second chain from hook and each stitch across turn ch1 double_crochet single_crochet across twice fasten_off and attach to back of ear covering the hole
